examples.caption: Databases can also be connected to via an Instance.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Create an object representing a Database.

params.name: connection
params.description: The connection to the Cloud Spanner Admin API.

params.name: instance
params.description: The instance in which the database exists.

params.name: lroConnection
params.description: An implementation mapping to methods which handle LRO resolution in the service.

params.name: returnInt64AsObject
params.description: [optional If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility. Defaults to false.

methods.name: name
methods.description: Return the fully-qualified database name.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Get the database info

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reload the database info from the Cloud Spanner API.

methods.name: exists
methods.description:
Check if the database exists.

This method sends a service request.

NOTE: Requires https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.admin scope.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Create a new Cloud Spanner database.

methods.name: updateDdl
methods.description:
Update the Database schema by running a SQL statement.

NOTE: Requires https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.admin scope.

params.name: statement
params.description: A DDL statements to run against a database.

methods.name: updateDdlBatch
methods.description:
Update the Database schema by running a set of SQL statements.

NOTE: Requires https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.admin scope.

params.name: statements
params.description: A list of DDL statements to run against a database.

methods.name: drop
methods.description:
Drop the database.

NOTE: Requires https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.admin scope.

methods.name: ddl
methods.description:
Get a list of all database DDL statements.

NOTE: Requires https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spanner.admin scope.

methods.name: iam
methods.description: Manage the database IAM policy

methods.name: snapshot
methods.description:
Create a snapshot to read from a database at a point in time.

If no configuration options are provided, transaction will be opened with strong consistency.

Snapshots are executed behind the scenes using a Read-Only Transaction.

examples.caption: Take a shapshot with a returned timestamp.

params.name: options
params.description:
Configuration Options

See [ReadOnly](https://cloud.google.com/spanner/reference/rpc/google.spanner.v1#google.spanner.v1.TransactionOptions.ReadOnly)
for detailed description of available options.

Please note that only one of `$strong`, `$readTimestamp` or
`$exactStaleness` may be set in a request.

params.name: options.returnReadTimestamp
params.description: If true, the Cloud Spanner-selected read timestamp is included in the Transaction message that describes the transaction.

params.name: options.strong
params.description: Read at a timestamp where all previously committed transactions are visible.

params.name: options.readTimestamp
params.description: Executes all reads at the given timestamp.

params.name: options.exactStaleness
params.description: Represents a number of seconds. Executes all reads at a timestamp that is $exactStaleness old.

params.name: options.minReadTimestamp
params.description: Executes all reads at a timestamp >= min_read_timestamp. Only available when $options.singleUse is true.

params.name: options.maxStaleness
params.description: Read data at a timestamp >= NOW - max_staleness seconds. Guarantees that all writes that have committed more than the specified number of seconds ago are visible. Only available when $options.singleUse is true.

params.name: options.singleUse
params.description: If true, a Transaction ID will not be allocated up front. Instead, the transaction will be considered "single-use", and may be used for only a single operation. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description:
If attempting to call this method within
        an existing transaction.

methods.name: transaction
methods.description:
Create and return a new read/write Transaction.

When manually using a Transaction, it is advised that retry logic be implemented to reapply all operations when an instance of Google\Cloud\Core\Exception\AbortedException is thrown.

If you wish Google Cloud PHP to handle retry logic for you (recommended for most cases), use Google\Cloud\Spanner\Database::runTransaction().

Please note that once a transaction reads data, it will lock the read data, preventing other users from modifying that data. For this reason, it is important that every transaction commits or rolls back as early as possible. Do not hold transactions open longer than necessary.

params.name: options.singleUse
params.description: If true, a Transaction ID will not be allocated up front. Instead, the transaction will be considered "single-use", and may be used for only a single operation. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description:
If attempting to call this method within
        an existing transaction.

methods.name: runTransaction
methods.description:
Execute Read/Write operations inside a Transaction.

Using this method and providing a callable operation provides certain benefits including automatic retry when a transaction fails. In case of a failure, all transaction operations, including reads, are re-applied in a new transaction.

If a transaction exceeds the maximum number of retries, Google\Cloud\Core\Exception\AbortedException will be thrown. Any other exception types will immediately bubble up and will interrupt the retry operation.

Please note that once a transaction reads data, it will lock the read data, preventing other users from modifying that data. For this reason, it is important that every transaction commits or rolls back as early as possible. Do not hold transactions open longer than necessary.

Please also note that nested transactions are NOT supported by this client. Attempting to call runTransaction inside a transaction callable will raise a BadMethodCallException.

If a callable finishes executing without invoking Google\Cloud\Spanner\Transaction::commit() or Google\Cloud\Spanner\Transaction::rollback(), the transaction will automatically be rolled back and \RuntimeException thrown.

params.name: operation
params.description: The operations to run in the transaction. Signature: function (Transaction $transaction).

params.name: options.maxRetries
params.description: The number of times to attempt to apply the operation before failing. Defaults to 10.

params.name: options.singleUse
params.description: If true, a Transaction ID will not be allocated up front. Instead, the transaction will be considered "single-use", and may be used for only a single operation. Note that in a single-use transaction, only a single operation may be executed, and rollback is not available. Defaults to false.

exceptions.description: If a transaction is not committed or rolled back.

If attempting to call this method within
        an existing transaction.

methods.name: insert
methods.description:
Insert a row.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

Since this method does not feature replay protection, it may attempt to apply mutations more than once; if the mutations are not idempotent, this may lead to a failure being reported when the mutation was previously applied.

methods.name: insertBatch
methods.description:
Insert multiple rows.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

Since this method does not feature replay protection, it may attempt to apply mutations more than once; if the mutations are not idempotent, this may lead to a failure being reported when the mutation was previously applied.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update a row.

Only data which you wish to update need be included. The list of columns must contain enough columns to allow Cloud Spanner to derive values for all primary key columns in the row to be modified.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

methods.name: updateBatch
methods.description:
Update multiple rows.

Only data which you wish to update need be included. The list of columns must contain enough columns to allow Cloud Spanner to derive values for all primary key columns in the row(s) to be modified.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

methods.name: insertOrUpdate
methods.description:
Insert or update a row.

If a row already exists (determined by comparing the Primary Key to existing table data), the row will be updated. If not, it will be created.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

params.name: data
params.description: The row data to insert or update.

methods.name: insertOrUpdateBatch
methods.description:
Insert or update multiple rows.

If a row already exists (determined by comparing the Primary Key to existing table data), the row will be updated. If not, it will be created.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

params.name: dataSet
params.description: The row data to insert or update.

methods.name: replace
methods.description:
Replace a row.

Provide data for the entire row. Cloud Spanner will attempt to find a record matching the Primary Key, and will replace the entire row. If a matching row is not found, it will be inserted.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

methods.name: replaceBatch
methods.description:
Replace multiple rows.

Provide data for the entire row. Cloud Spanner will attempt to find a record matching the Primary Key, and will replace the entire row. If a matching row is not found, it will be inserted.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete one or more rows.

Mutations are committed in a single-use transaction.

Since this method does not feature replay protection, it may attempt to apply mutations more than once; if the mutations are not idempotent, this may lead to a failure being reported when the mutation was previously applied.

params.name: keySet
params.description: The KeySet to identify rows to delete.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Run a query.

examples.caption: Execute a read and return a new Snapshot for further reads.
Execute a read and return a new Transaction for further reads and writes.
Parameters which may be null must include an expected parameter type.
Array parameters which may be null or empty must include the array value type.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options. See TransactionOptions for detailed description of available transaction options. Please note that only one of $strong, $minReadTimestamp, $maxStaleness, $readTimestamp or $exactStaleness may be set in a request.

params.name: options.parameters
params.description: A key/value array of Query Parameters, where the key is represented in the query string prefixed by a @ symbol.

params.name: options.types
params.description: A key/value array of Query Parameter types. Generally, Google Cloud PHP can infer types. Explicit type definitions are only necessary for null parameter values. Accepted values are defined as constants on Google\Cloud\Spanner\ValueMapper, and are as follows: Database::TYPE_BOOL, Database::TYPE_INT64, Database::TYPE_FLOAT64, Database::TYPE_TIMESTAMP, Database::TYPE_DATE, Database::TYPE_STRING, Database::TYPE_BYTES, Database::TYPE_ARRAY and Database::TYPE_STRUCT. If the parameter type is an array, the type should be given as an array, where the first element is Database::TYPE_ARRAY and the second element is the array type, for instance [Database::TYPE_ARRAY, Database::TYPE_INT64].

params.name: options.returnReadTimestamp
params.description: If true, the Cloud Spanner-selected read timestamp is included in the Transaction message that describes the transaction.

params.name: options.strong
params.description: Read at a timestamp where all previously committed transactions are visible.

params.name: options.minReadTimestamp
params.description: Execute reads at a timestamp >= the given timestamp. Only available in single-use transactions.

params.name: options.maxStaleness
params.description: Read data at a timestamp >= NOW - the given timestamp. Only available in single-use transactions.

params.name: options.readTimestamp
params.description: Executes all reads at the given timestamp.

params.name: options.exactStaleness
params.description: Represents a number of seconds. Executes all reads at a timestamp that is $exactStaleness old.

params.name: options.begin
params.description: If true, will begin a new transaction. If a read/write transaction is desired, set the value of $transactionType. If a transaction or snapshot is created, it will be returned as $result->transaction() or $result->snapshot(). Defaults to false.

params.name: options.transactionType
params.description: One of SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ or SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READWRITE. If read/write is chosen, any snapshot options will be disregarded. If $begin is false, transaction type MUST be SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ. Defaults to SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Lookup rows in a table.

examples.caption: Execute a read and return a new Snapshot for further reads.
Execute a read and return a new Transaction for further reads and writes.

params.name: columns
params.description: A list of column names to return.

params.name: options
params.description:
Configuration Options.

See [TransactionOptions](https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/reference/rpc/google.spanner.v1#google.spanner.v1.TransactionOptions)
for detailed description of available transaction options.

Please note that only one of `$strong`, `$minReadTimestamp`,
`$maxStaleness`, `$readTimestamp` or `$exactStaleness` may be set in
a request.

params.name: options.index
params.description: The name of an index on the table.

params.name: options.returnReadTimestamp
params.description: If true, the Cloud Spanner-selected read timestamp is included in the Transaction message that describes the transaction.

params.name: options.strong
params.description: Read at a timestamp where all previously committed transactions are visible.

params.name: options.minReadTimestamp
params.description: Execute reads at a timestamp >= the given timestamp. Only available in single-use transactions.

params.name: options.maxStaleness
params.description: Read data at a timestamp >= NOW - the given timestamp. Only available in single-use transactions.

params.name: options.readTimestamp
params.description: Executes all reads at the given timestamp.

params.name: options.exactStaleness
params.description: Represents a number of seconds. Executes all reads at a timestamp that is $exactStaleness old.

params.name: options.begin
params.description: If true, will begin a new transaction. If a read/write transaction is desired, set the value of $transactionType. If a transaction or snapshot is created, it will be returned as $result->transaction() or $result->snapshot(). Defaults to false.

params.name: options.transactionType
params.description: One of SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ or SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READWRITE. If read/write is chosen, any snapshot options will be disregarded. If $begin is false, transaction type MUST be SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ. Defaults to SessionPoolInterface::CONTEXT_READ.

methods.name: sessionPool
methods.description: Get the underlying session pool implementation.

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes the database connection by returning the active session back to the session pool queue or by deleting the session if there is no pool associated.

It is highly important to ensure this is called as it is not always safe to rely soley on Google\Cloud\Spanner\Database::__destruct().

methods.name: __destruct
methods.description: Closes the database connection.

methods.description:
Resume a Long Running Operation

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\LongRunning\LROTrait

methods.name: longRunningOperations

List long running operations.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\LongRunning\LROTrait

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.
